attributes.action: Re-Debate Syrian intervention when better informed by the UN Inspection
attributes.additional_details:
The Government has debated Syrian intervention without sufficient evidence. So it is no surprise the vote failed.

Which ever side is responsible, we simply cannot stand by & watch over 100,000 people perish. The Syrian regime should have listened to their people to avoid the current conflict.

Chemical weapons or not, a more informed & better calculated response is required by Government & the international community that avoids or minimises the loss of life and enables a more stable outcome for the whole region.

Our country has an obligation to continually assess and reassess the situation. The Government should acquire concrete evidence & re-debate the issue.
